title.title: Festive travel advice for Victoria Coach Station

texts: Londoners and visitors to the capital travelling by coach should plan their journeys carefully, as some services will be limited.
It is also essential to make advance bookings for all travel during this period.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eChristmas Eve\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eFull range of coach services operating in the UK and to European destinations but services start to wind down after midday. Advance booking for travel on Christmas Eve is essential.","\u003cstrong\u003eChristmas Day\u003c/strong\u003e Limited services to mainland Europe and express coach service to and from Stansted Airport. No services within the UK.","\u003cstrong\u003eBoxing Day\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eLimited services operating to most destinations. Phone operator for details.","\u003cstrong\u003e28, 29, 30, 31 December 2005\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eLimited services operating to most destinations. Phone operator for details.","\u003cstrong\u003eNew Year's Eve\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eServices operating through out the day - but advance booking essential.","\u003cstrong\u003eNew Year's Day\u003c/strong\u003e Reduced services operating. Phone operator for details."]}

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts
